base.$description: Use as the default canvas for the UI.

subtle.$description: Use as alternative canvas for the UI. Reserved for when you only want a hint of color.

base.$description: Use as the default background of elements.

subtle.$description: Use as subtle alternative for backgrounds.

subtler.$description: Use as subtler alternative for backgrounds.

disabled.$description: Use for backgrounds in a disabled state.

brand.$description: Use for branded background, like buttons or widgets

brandSubtle.$description: Use for subtle branded background, like pills or widgets or on selected state

negative.$description: Use for striking backgrounds communicating negative information, such in error buttons

negativeSubtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating negative information, such in error alerts.

positive.$description: Use for striking backgrounds communicating positive information

positiveSubtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating positive information, such in success alerts.

warning.$description: Use for striking backgrounds communicating warning information

warningSubtle.$description: Use for backgrounds communicating warning information, such in warning alerts.

scrim.$description: use for scrim, covering content behind modals or panels

base.$description: Use to emphasise primary content, such as headers and long body copy

subtle.$description: Use for supportive elements that give context to content that's close to it. think of icons, interactive elements etc

brand.$description: Use for branded content, often in interactive context.

brandBold.$description: Use for branded content on brandSubtle background

disabled.$description: Use for content in a disabled state.

onBrand.$description: Use for content on Brand color like the button or branded widgets

inverted.$description: Use for inverse content on a bold background. Turns dark on dark mode to keep elements visible.

alwaysWhite.$description: Use for content which should always stay white, eg content on a dark image

alwaysBlack.$description: Use for content which should always stay black, eg content on a light image

negative.$description: Indicates negative sentiment, for example on negative amounts, error states or destructive actions.

negativeBold.$description: Indicates negative sentiment placed, for example on negative amounts, error states or destructive actions.

positive.$description: Indicates positive sentiment, for example on increasing amounts or success states.This cannot be used for text for a11y reasons.

positiveBold.$description: Indicates positive sentiment, for example on increasing amounts or success states.

warning.$description: Indicates warning sentiment, for example on alerts.This cannot be used for text for a11y reasons.

warningBold.$description: Indicates warning sentiment background, for example on alerts.

link.$description: Use for links that appear inline text.

disabled.$description: Use for borders in a disabled state.

brand.$description: Use for branded borders, often in interactive context.

brandSubtle.$description: Use for subtle branded borders, often in interactive context.

onBrand.$description: Use for borders on Brand color like the button or branded widgets

inverted.$description: Use for inverse borders on a bold background. Turns dark on dark mode to keep elements visible.

alwaysWhite.$description: Use for borders which should always stay white, eg borders on a dark image

alwaysBlack.$description: Use for borders which should always stay black, eg borders on a light image

negative.$description: Indicates negative sentiment on borders, for example on error states or destructive actions.

positive.$description: Indicates positive sentiment on borders, for example on success states.

warning.$description: Indicates warning sentiment on borders, for example on alerts.

hover.$description: Use for hover state of links that appear inline text.

active.$description: Use for pressed state of links that appear inline text.

hover.$description: Use this state on bigger interactive components,  when there is no shadow as state effect

active.$description: Use this state on bigger interactive components,  when there is no shadow as state effect

hover.$description: Use this state on small interactive components adding a subtle branded emphasis, such as a secondary button, pill, navigation items, …

active.$description: Use this state on small interactive components adding a subtle branded emphasis, such as a secondary button, pill, navigation items, …

hover.$description: Use this state on components brand or error backgrounds, such as primary or error button

active.$description: Use this state on components brand or error backgrounds, such as primary or error button
